skill.name: protocolsio-integration
skill.description: Integration with protocols.io API for managing scientific protocols. This skill should be used when working with protocols.io to search, create, update, or publish protocols; manage protocol steps and materials; handle discussions and comments; organize workspaces; upload and manage files; or integrate protocols.io functionality into workflows. Applicable for protocol discovery, collaborative protocol development, experiment tracking, lab protocol management, and scientific documentation.
skill.summary: Integration with protocols.io API for managing scientific protocols. This skill should be used when ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: All files are documentation and example requests for the protocols.io API. No code executes commands, reads local secrets, or performs hidden network activity beyond documented API endpoints.

content.user_title: Integrate protocols.io API into lab workflows
content.value_statement: Finding and managing lab protocols across teams is slow and fragmented. This skill guides you through protocols.io API workflows for search, creation, discussion, and file handling.
actual_capabilities: Explain authentication flows and token usage
Guide protocol search, creation, update, and publish steps
Describe workspace listing and membership actions
Detail file upload, download, and metadata updates
Cover experiment run creation and tracking
limitations: Does not execute API calls or store credentials
Requires a valid protocols.io access token
Cannot access private protocols without proper permissions
No offline synchronization or local file management

use_cases.title: Standardize lab protocols
use_cases.description: Create and publish consistent protocols with steps, materials, and version notes across a team workspace.

use_cases.title: Build protocol discovery tools
use_cases.description: Search and retrieve protocol metadata to support internal dashboards and literature review pipelines.

use_cases.title: Coordinate protocol feedback
use_cases.description: Use discussion endpoints to gather and respond to step-level feedback from collaborators.

prompt_templates.title: Start with auth
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to obtain and use a protocols.io access token and how to refresh it safely.

prompt_templates.title: Search protocols
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to search public protocols by keyword and return results in HTML format.

prompt_templates.title: Create and publish
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline the API steps to create a protocol, add steps, and publish with a DOI.

prompt_templates.title: Workspace file flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide the endpoints to upload a file to a workspace folder and verify processing status.

output_examples.input: How do I publish a protocol with a DOI and note version changes?
output: Authenticate with a valid access token
Create or update the protocol record
Submit publish request with version notes and publish type
Record the assigned DOI for citation

best_practices: Store tokens securely and avoid client side exposure
Implement retry and backoff for rate limits
Document protocol steps and changes clearly
anti_patterns: Hardcoding access tokens in source files
Publishing protocols without review and version notes

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides API guidance usable in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limits of the skill?
faq.answer: It offers guidance only and does not make API calls or manage tokens for you.

faq.question: How does it integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: You can map the documented endpoints into your scripts or applications.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It only explains endpoints and best practices for secure use.

faq.question: What should I do if a request fails?
faq.answer: Check token validity, permissions, and rate limits, then retry with backoff.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic API help?
faq.answer: It is focused on protocols.io endpoints, workflows, and common lab use cases.
